titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 9/20/05. Plaintiff must continue to proceed pro se in matter as King Hall Civil Rights Clinic has failed to respond. Clerk directed to serve a copy of Order upon Carter White of King Hall Civil Rights Clinic as well as parties in action. The dates for filing of Pretrial Statements and for Trial are hereby VACATED pending adjudication of pending Motion for Summary Judgment to be re-set, if appropriate. (Marciel, M) Modified on 11/8/2005 (Marciel, M).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ADOPTING FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS 68 signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 09/29/06 ORDERING that dfts' motion for summary judgment 56 is GRANTED as to plt's inapposite Fifth Amendment claims for violations of the Double Jeopardy and Ex Post Facto Clauses. Granted with respect to any claims made pursuant to the First, Sixth and Eighth Amendments. Granted as to plt's claims of violations of his rights under the substantive due process clause under the Fourteenth Amendment. Granted on the basis of qualified immunity. Judgment is to be entered for defendants. (Duong, D)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:03-cv-00241; (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al;

Judgment is to be entered for defendants. (Duong, D)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 03/20/09 ordering Kelly Theodore Smith of the Smith Law Firm is hereby appointed as pro bono counsel for plaintiff in this action and is substituted in as counsel of record for plaintiff in place of Scott H. Frewing of Baker & McKenzie LLP. In addition to defendants' counsel and Mr. Frewing, the clerk shall electronically serve a copy of this order on Kelly Theodore Smith at ktsmith@thesmithfirm.com. (See order for further details)(Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: [STAY LIFTED PURSUANT TO 100 ORDER] ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 5/18/09 ORDERING that this matter is to be set for a settlement conference before a Magistrate Judge other than the undersigned; Clerk of the Court is directed to randomly assign another Magistrate Judge for purposes of holding a settlement conference in this case. Discovery, or the question of re-opened discovery, in this remanded case is stayed, pending the outcome of the settlement conference.(Dillon, M) Modified on 8/21/2009 (Yin, K).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: [VACATED PURSUANT TO 8/17/09 ORDER]ORDER AND WRIT ISSUED signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 8/4/09 ORDERING issuance of writ of habeas corpus ad testificandum; Custodian to produce Terry Jane Meyers #CO-000064-6, to testify in USDC at 9:30 AM on 8/20/09 in courtroom #25, before Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan; Custodian is ordered to notify the court of any change in custody of this inmate and is ordered to provide the new custodian w/ a copy of this writ. Clerk to serve a copy of this order and writ on the Out-to-Court Desk and Warden of Coalinga State Hospital. (cc: USM Priority)(Yin, K) 3 certified copies served on Warden. 1 certified copy served on the Out-to-Court desk. Courtesy copy faxed to Warden Denise Wilson and Out-to-Court Desk. Modified on 8/4/2009 (Yin, K). Modified on 8/17/2009 (Plummer, M).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 08/26/09 ordering the motion 101 presumes too much and the stipulation is rejected by the court. Counsel for plaintiff must appear before the court at the time noticed for the hearing, as noted herein, although it will not be necessary for defendants' counsel to make an appearance pursuant to the statement of non-opposition filed on 08/26/09 102. Counsel for plaintiff must be prepared to address both his own response and that of plaintiff. (See order for further detail) (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 9/21/09 ORDERING that pltf's counsel's 101 motion to withdraw as counsel is GRANTED; pltf must proceed PRO SE until such time as new counsel can, if possible, be located and substituted in; the parties are CAUTIONED that the 100 Order setting a new deadline of 1/15/2010, for re-opened discovery and a 6/14/2010 dispositive motion deadline REMAINS IN EFFECT; in addition to counsel for both parties, this order is to be served upon pltf pro se at the mailing address pltf included in his 104 letter ; and the clerk to note in the dkt that pltf now proceeds pro se. (Yin, K)

(Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Chief Circuit Judge Alex Kozinski on 7/8/2010. Mediation Hearing, to be conducted by Joe Ramsey, set for 8/9/2010 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1. Plaintiff shall personally attend, via video conference, from current place of detention. A separate Order and Writ of Habeas Ad Testificandum will issue with this Order. Parties directed to provide confidential Settlement Conference Statements to Sujean Park no later than 7/30/2010. (Marciel, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Meyers v. Pope, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Chief Circuit Judge Alex Kozinski on 10/17/11: Joann L. Pheasant is appointed limited purpose counsel. (Kaminski, H)
